item.title: SonarQube with JaCoCo in multi-module Maven project
item.description: This post explains in detail how to set up a SonarQube code analysis using the Sonar Maven Plugin including code coverage with the JaCoCo Maven plugin. Although the setup is already documented within this SonarSource Community post, this post highlights pitfalls and enables you to adapt any Maven module structure such that it correctly measures and imports code coverage into your SonarQube analysis. This post focuses on using the official documentation from JaCoCo and Sonar.

item.title: Breaking your build on SonarQube quality gate failure
item.description: We use SonarQube to do a static analysis of our code for code smells, security bugs and more. SonarQube had a great feature in earlier versions: breaking the build if the quality gate of your project is red. A quality gate defines the metrics you want your code to have, for example: no detected bugs, code coverage 80% or more, no TODO comments. SonarQube quality gates help us to follow the rule “don’t live with broken windows”1 in our daily work.
